availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Cincinnati, Hamilton County, Ohio, soldier. Ohio native. Son of Cornelius Moore and Ann Moore. Resident of Cincinnati in 1850 and 1860. Served in the 5th Ohio Infantry as lieutenant and captain from April 1861 to July 1862. Served in the 83rd Ohio Infantry as colonel from September 1862 to March 1865. Brevetted brigadier general of volunteers in March 1865. Mustered out of service in July 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, County, Cincinnati, Ward 7, p. 291B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, County, Cincinnati, Ward 7, p. 437.
Francis B. Heitman, Historical Register and Dictionary of the United States Army, from it's Organization, September 29, 1789, to March 2, 1903 vol. 1, pt. 2 (Washington: Government Printing Office, 1903), p. 722
Find A Grave, "Frederick W. Moore (1840-1905)," Memorial #5951263, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/5951263 (accessed December 13, 2019).
